instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .
definitions.PP1V8_AWAKE: What is PP1V8_AWAKE? The PP1V8_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is indicative of a power rail that delivers 1.8 volts when the machine is in an "awake" state. This is not a traditional power state defined in the older Intel PCH documentation; it seems to be specific to newer MacBook architectures. The "awake" designation likely refers to a state where the MacBook is on and ready for user interaction, but it is not necessarily at full operational capacity (which would be denoted by an S0 state).
definitions.PP1V1_SLPS2R: What is PP1V1_SLPS2R? The PP1V1_SLPS2R power rail in the MacBook schematic provides a 1.1-volt supply in a specific low-power state indicated by the "_SLPS2R" suffix and is used for powering the T2 chip..
definitions.PP1V2_AWAKE: What is PP1V2_AWAKE? The PP1V2_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides 1.2 volts and is associated with the machine's awake state and is used for powering the T2 chip..
definitions.P5VG3S_EN: What is P5VG3S_EN? This signal enables the PP5V_G3S power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PP3V_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V_G3H_RTC? PP3V_G3H_RTC is a 3v power rail present when the machine is in a G3H mechanical off state that powers the RTC circuit. .
definitions.PP0V9_SSD0: What is PP0V9_SSD0? This is a power rail for the soldered on SSD on newer Macbooks. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead pp5v
threads.message:
fan speed for 2 second then stop and start again and do not stop, no keyboard activity 
there was damage at L8504 ( <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S_ALSCAM</SIGNAL>-<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S_CPUREG_MISC</SIGNAL>)near screen connector and whiteout screen SHOW 0.2V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead pp5v
threads.message:
The problem could be caused by some short inside video cable.
Disconnect J8500 and check for USB activity and external video.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead pp5v
threads.message: o.k i was find that the  <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S_CPUREG_MISC</SIGNAL> line was cut so i make jumper and i have 5.3v now, but still just fan spin and cpu is cold, there is usb activity, no screen also no charging sound and no video with external screen.

threads.message:
"there is usb activity"
Did you see flashing Link LED on USB device???

Check if machine is detected in DFU mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead pp5v
threads.message:
"Yes the is light on the adapter they I connect."
Light on means steady light?
The activity can be checked with Link LED, which MUST flash; read "How To colecction" thread.

Is now detected in DFU?
Try the board disconnecting keyboard/trackpad.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead pp5v
threads.message:
I was talking about audio BOARD and audio FLEX, apart of audio connector.
Leakage from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to T2 data lines mostly occurs on these components.

Remove audio board and inspect both sides for corrosion.

threads.message:
If you have all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages, it should be detected in DFU.
If not, bad T2...
